title: 103_s1152
content: There is no relevant information provided in the prev_chunk to summarize the curr_chunk. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to extend certain duty suspensions by changing the effective period to "12/31/96" for various chemical substances. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to extend duty suspensions for chemical substances like nitroaniline, broenner's acid, naphthol derivatives, and 3-aminomethoxybenzanilide. Additionally, a new suspension for sulfamic acid is added to the schedule. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to extend duty suspensions for various chemical substances. A new suspension for sulfamic acid is added to the schedule under subheading 2811.19.50. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to extend duty suspensions for various chemical substances including R Salt, Alizarine, and Bon Acid. These suspensions are in effect until 12/31/96. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States extends duty suspensions for chemical substances including Fast Red ITR Base, 2,5-Dichloraniline, and 2,4-Dinitroaniline until 12/31/96. Chemical substances including Meta-nitro-para-toluidine, C Amine SC4 Acid, and Tobias Acid are duty-free until 12/31/96. Chemical substances Acetoacet-o-Chloranilide and Acetoacet-2,5-Dimethoxyanilide are duty-free until 12/31/96. The amendments made by this Act apply to articles entered or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption after the 15th day following the enactment of this Act.
